scientific_name: Camassia leichtlinii subsp. suksdorfii 'Blauwe Donau' BLUE DANUBE

hardiness_location.full_iframe: <iframe frameborder=0 scrolling=yes seamless=seamless width=1000 height=550 style='margin:auto;' src='https://perenual.com/api/hardiness-map?species_id=1523&size=og&key=sk-kMpx68b02586bb61112084'></iframe>

description: Camassia leichtlinii subsp. suksdorfii 'Blauwe Donau' BLUE DANUBE is a stunning and robust perennial flower native to North America. It blooms in late spring and summer, producing beautiful sky-blue blooms that resemble stars. Once in bloom its sturdy stems are clothed in up to thirty starry, five-pointed deep sky-blue flowers. This plant is tough and drought-resistant, creating a strong presence when planted in rock gardens, cottage-style gardens, and border facings. Its stunning flower display will bring vibrant shades of blue to gardens and create a striking contrast when partnered with other plants. It is perfect for any sunny spot in the garden and will be an amazing addition to any garden.
